title.native: チェインクロニクル ～ヘクセイタスの閃(ひかり)～
title.english: Chain Chronicle - The Light of Haecceitas -

description:
This is the story of the Chain Chronicle, a book that describes everything that happens in the world. The citizens of the remote continent of Yggd once thought that there was nothing beyond their continent. The continent was divided into several regions, each with its own king. Though there were small skirmishes amongst them, a lord, chosen by the kings in conference, always maintained balance, until the evil Black Army arrived. The Volunteer Army, led by Yuri, was no match for the Black Army. During the fighting, the Lord of Black captures half of the Chain Chronicle, as well as the capital.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kudo_M_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kudo_m_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVcxdd04vCuhr-1t7mDh3gg)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Most known for his work on the [Bleach](https://anilist.co/anime/269/) franchise.

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mtocoda/)

He worked as a music composer for Capcom after graduating from the Kunitachi College of Music. He left the company in 2003 and founded Design Wave in 2007, and is still working as a composer for video games.  He is known for his work on the Devil May Cry and Monster Hunter series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kudo_M_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kudo_m_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVcxdd04vCuhr-1t7mDh3gg)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Most known for his work on the [Bleach](https://anilist.co/anime/269/) franchise.

[Official Website](https://nanonano.me/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanonano_me?s=20&t=4VTA1umvQXVSsyul5mYvQg) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/officialnanoTV) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nanonano_me/?hl=ja)


nano is a female singer/song writer on NicoNicoDouga who covers Vocaloid and non-Vocaloid songs in Japanese and English. She has participated in many translations and collaborations because of fluency. nano moved back to Japan during middle school. This is where the “帰国子女” in one of his or her video titles comes from. Kikokushijo means “one who has returned to their homeland”.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/滝口禎一)

Currently affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Worked at [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/) for 30 years.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kudo_M_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kudo_m_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVcxdd04vCuhr-1t7mDh3gg)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Most known for his work on the [Bleach](https://anilist.co/anime/269/) franchise.

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)
Ookubo Masahiro is a Japanese screenwriter.

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kudo_M_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kudo_m_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVcxdd04vCuhr-1t7mDh3gg)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Most known for his work on the [Bleach](https://anilist.co/anime/269/) franchise.
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.
